pull.title: docs: adds correct updated documentation links
pull.body:
Added correct links to the docs in place of the missing docs' paths.
Fixes #32565

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/32699.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#32541](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32541) (index: store per-block transaction locations for efficient lookups by romanz)
* [#31974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31974) (Drop testnet3 by Sjors)
* [#31860](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31860) (init: Take lock on blocks directory in BlockManager ctor by TheCharlatan)
* [#31845](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31845) (Add -pruneduringinit option to temporarily use another prune target during IBD by luke-jr)
* [#29678](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29678) (Bugfix: Correct first-run free space checks by luke-jr)
* [#29415](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29415) (Broadcast own transactions only via short-lived Tor or I2P connections by vasild)
* [#29278](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29278) (Wallet:  Add `maxfeerate` wallet startup option by ismaelsadeeq)
* [#28792](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28792) (Embed default ASMap as binary dump header file by fjahr)
* [#26966](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26966) (index: initial sync speedup, parallelize process by furszy)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->
### LLM Linter (✨ experimental)

Possible typos and grammar issues:

- ""thus -> " thus [remove extraneous quote before `thus` in the string literal]

<sup>drahtbot_id_4_m</sup>
This makes it necessary to manually update the links with every release, or at least with every new version that contains changes to those documentation files.

> This makes it necessary to manually update the links with every release, or at least with every new version that contains changes to those documentation files.

it does, still trying to get a workaround that automatically updates it

> This makes it necessary to manually update the links with every release, or at least with every new version that contains changes to those documentation files.

i have update it so it fetches the docs based on build version
You can squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits.

> You can squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits.

thankyou for this

I checked out v29.0 with the changes, I got: 
`  -cjdnsreachable
       If set, then this host is configured for CJDNS (connecting to fc00::/8
       addresses would lead us to the CJDNS network, see
       https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v29.0/doc/cjdns.md)
       (default: 0)
`
which links correctly, the function `GetDocumentationUrl` looks good to me

Thankyou for the feedback

comments.body:
Running on master branch, I get: 
```sh
 -signer=<cmd>
       External signing tool, see
       https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v29.99/doc/external-signer.md
```
...which is incorrect since there is no v29.99.
this could be because you are on developement version. Let me try set it to the latest stable version

Thanks for the PR! I notice there are some whitespace changes that appear unrelated to the main goal of fixing documentation references. 
While these changes don't affect functionality, it would be helpful to keep the diff focused on the actual documentation URL changes. This makes the PR easier to review and reduces the risk of merge conflicts.

Could you please remove these unrelated whitespace changes? This will make the PR's intent clearer and follow the principle of keeping changes minimal and focused.

The core changes to fix the documentation references look good.
